PageTitle: peer tcp-mss (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view) (group)
FuncDef:
The peer tcp-mss command configures a TCP MSS value used when the local device establishes TCP connections with a peer group.
The undo peer tcp-mss command deletes the configured TCP MSS value. The peer tcp-mss command configures a TCP MSS value used when the local device establishes TCP connections with a peer group. The undo peer tcp-mss command deletes the configured TCP MSS value. By default, no TCP MSS is configured for the local device to establish TCP connections with a peer group.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters and cannot contain spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.

Specifies the maximum TCP MSS value used for TCP connection establishment.
The value is an integer ranging from 176 to 4096, in bytes.

ExtraInfo: You can run the peer tcp-mss command to configure a TCP MSS value used during TCP connection establishment with the specified peer group. The value ranges from 176 to 4096 and is used to fragment TCP packets when the path MTU is unavailable. Such configuration improves network performance.
